title: [BSOG0002] Formula - The Overcast Project
description:
Ladies and gents, allow me to introduce to you the latest member of the blocSonic family, Formula. A producer extraordinaire hailing from London. This here is his premiere solo release and our second original. If youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been following our netBloc series for a while, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve most-likely heard Ã¢â‚¬Å“Is It Too Late For Us All?Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ from the collaborative project that he was part of (along with BostonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s own Tha Silent Partner), MUTE. It was featured on Ã¢â‚¬Å“netBloc Vol. 15: this album wonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t eat your gas moneyÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½. Welcome him back with what IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m quite confident youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll think is one fantastic release. Hip-Hop on another plainÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ from another perspectiveÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ but real boom bap hip-hop none-the-less. From the introduction Ã¢â‚¬Å“Ebony ShardsÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½Ã¢â‚¬Â¦ to Ã¢â‚¬Å“X ManÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, thereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not a boring or weak moment to be found.

To me Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Overcast ProjectÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ feels like the perfect follow-up to Just Plain AntÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Ã¢â‚¬Å“Dig DeepÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½. Formula seems to share a similar desire to expand the definition of Ã¢â‚¬Å“hip-hopÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½. With Formula at itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s core and a talented group of musicians and emcees, Overcast gels into a superbly cohesive unit (much like AntÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s release before it). There IS a Ã¢â‚¬Å“Formula soundÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and each of the guest musicians and emcees lend their distinctive touches in such a way as to make the unit stronger.

Sit back and get ready for the journeyÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ the sky may be overcast, but no rain is in the forecastÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ so enjoy the journey!

Thanks to Formula for allowing blocSonic to handle the release of this gem!

As always, thanks to you for visiting blocSonic and listening to our releasesÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ rememberÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ share this with friends, enemies, parents, siblings, politicians, zombies and aliensÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ ohÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ and the rain godsÃ¢â‚¬Â¦

Peace

Mike Gregoire

Founder/Curator blocSonic.com
